column4: .I have Ubuntu 10.10 installed, have used ubuntu since 9.04. now, I would like to install a new operating system but still keep ubuntu, so that my PC would be dual-boot

you may be in trouble if the second operating system is Windows; it needs to have the first partition free, so you'll need to mess around with first partitions and then your bootloader and you need to do it all from a LiveCD.
Shouldn't I be able to backup my Ubuntu, install Windows (reformat) and then run Ubuntu via VirtualBox?
